title: 2017 NRCS Gettysburg Casey Cronin/Dan Forgey "Winter Grazing Cover Crops"

tasks.task: Attend and speak at an agricultural event.
subtasks: Introduce co-speakers Casey and Corey Cronin.
Highlight the farm's transition to grazing cover crops since 2007.
Emphasize the importance of soil health and carbon in farming practices.
Discuss the farm's cattle operation, including cow-calf numbers and management practices.
Describe pasture management techniques, including rotating pastures and using divide fences.
Explain grazing strategies for different livestock stages (e.g., calves, heifers).
Present cover crop mix compositions and their benefits.
Discuss the effectiveness of grazing covers in resource protection.
Detail the impact of grazing covers on livestock performance and feed costs.
Share experiences with deer and climate challenges during grazing.
Highlight the benefits of multi-year cover crop rotations.
Advocate for the holistic approach to soil health and carbon management.

tasks.task: Promote sustainable farming practices through soil health and cover crop utilization.
subtasks: Highlight the value of retained residue and cover crop grazing.
Explain the role of cover crops in capturing water and enhancing organic matter.
Share knowledge on carbon-to-nitrogen ratios and their importance in cover crop selection.
Encourage audience research and critical evaluation of seed dealers.
Discuss the financial and environmental benefits of long-term cover crops.
